title: Bevo won't make Texas-OU due to life-threatening illness

DALLAS â€“ The University of Texas will have to go without the sideline support of mascot Bevo XIV in this Saturday's Red River Rivalry in Dallas because the bovine is battling a "life-threatening" illness, the Longhorn Network reported Wednesday. 
Bevo XIV, who has served as UT's mascot since 2004, will remain in Austin to be treated by vets, according to our sister station in Austin, KVUE . 
The Silver Spurs , the student service organization responsible for the longhorn steer's care, did not disclose the Bevo's condition. 
"Bevo is a fighter, a symbol of strength and who fans across the world care deeply about. We are carefully monitoring Bevo's condition at this time and will update the public as we find out more about his condition. The safety and well being of Bevo XIV is always our primary concern, and therefore he will not be attending the game on Saturday" said Ricky Brennes, the executive director of the Silver Spurs Alumni Association, in a release. 
Texas plays Oklahoma this Saturday at 11 a.m. in the Cotton Bowl. The game air on Ch. 8. Read or Share this story: http://on.wfaa.com/1RunbvX TOP VIDEOS
